synopsis.p: This month we have a few talks for your delight. The first is a quick introdcution to OPENapps, and then a dose of Perl mayhem, and then a look at some of the modules Richard Dice has been using lately.

description.p: Imagine you create a web application and had the ability to sell it to many web site owners on the internet. Now imagine you could sell it without giving up the source code. OPENapps makes this happen.

OPENapps is a powerful language agnostic platform allowing you to offer up web applications to a wide audience of website owners. OPENapps takes care of the things that developers typically find boring or repetitious such as billing and tracking; while at the same time providing robust technology for integration of your applications with content publishers sites.
OPENapps is offering a limited developer beta to web developers who demonstrate that they have a killer app idea and a desire to implement it.
A little delayed gratification from last year's Lightning Talks.

talk.speaker: Richard Dice
talk.title: Show & Tell - Modules Richard is using

description.p: A look at some of the things Richard is working with these days, including Coro, AnyEvent and the daemonization of Perl code.
